definitions.text: some abrupt occurrence that interrupts an ongoing activity
examples: the telephone is an annoying interruption
there was a break in the action when a player was hurt

definitions.text: an unexpected piece of good luck
examples: he finally got his big break

definitions.text: (geology) a crack in the earth's crust resulting from the displacement of one side with respect to the other
examples: they built it right over a geological fault
he studied the faulting of the earth's crust

definitions.text: a personal or social separation (as between opposing factions)
examples: they hoped to avoid a break in relations

definitions.text: a pause from doing something (as work)
examples: we took a 10-minute break
he took time out to recuperate

definitions.text: the act of breaking something
examples: the breakage was unavoidable

definitions.text: a time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something
breaking of hard tissue such as bone
examples: it was a nasty fracture
the break seems to have been caused by a fall

definitions.text: the occurrence of breaking
examples: the break in the dam threatened the valley

definitions.text: an abrupt change in the tone or register of the voice (as at puberty or due to emotion)
examples: then there was a break in her voice

definitions.text: the opening shot that scatters the balls in billiards or pool
(tennis) a score consisting of winning a game when your opponent was serving
examples: he was up two breaks in the second set

definitions.text: an act of delaying or interrupting the continuity
examples: it was presented without commercial breaks
there was a gap in his account

definitions.text: a sudden dash
examples: he made a break for the open door

definitions.text: any frame in which a bowler fails to make a strike or spare
examples: the break in the eighth frame cost him the match

definitions.text: an escape from jail
examples: the breakout was carefully planned

definitions.text: terminate
examples: She interrupted her pregnancy
break a lucky streak
break the cycle of poverty

definitions.text: become separated into pieces or fragments
examples: The figurine broke
The freshly baked loaf fell apart

definitions.text: render inoperable or ineffective
examples: You broke the alarm clock when you took it apart!

definitions.text: ruin completely
examples: He busted my radio!

definitions.text: destroy the integrity of; usually by force; cause to separate into pieces or fragments
examples: He broke the glass plate
She broke the match

definitions.text: act in disregard of laws, rules, contracts, or promises
examples: offend all laws of humanity
violate the basic laws or human civilization
break a law
break a promise

definitions.text: move away or escape suddenly
examples: The horses broke from the stable
Three inmates broke jail
Nobody can break out--this prison is high security

definitions.text: scatter or part
examples: The clouds broke after the heavy downpour

definitions.text: force out or release suddenly and often violently something pent up
examples: break into tears
erupt in anger

definitions.text: prevent completion
examples: stop the project
break off the negotiations

definitions.text: enter someone's (virtual or real) property in an unauthorized manner, usually with the intent to steal or commit a violent act
examples: Someone broke in while I was on vacation
They broke into my car and stole my radio!
who broke into my account last night?

definitions.text: make submissive, obedient, or useful
examples: The horse was tough to break
I broke in the new intern

definitions.text: fail to agree with; be in violation of; as of rules or patterns
examples: This sentence violates the rules of syntax

definitions.text: surpass in excellence
examples: She bettered her own record
break a record

definitions.text: make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret
examples: The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold
The actress won't reveal how old she is
bring out the truth
he broke the news to her
unwrap the evidence in the murder case

definitions.text: come into being
examples: light broke over the horizon
Voices broke in the air

definitions.text: stop operating or functioning
examples: The engine finally went
The car died on the road
The bus we travelled in broke down on the way to town
The coffee maker broke
The engine failed on the way to town
her eyesight went after the accident

definitions.text: interrupt a continued activity
examples: She had broken with the traditional patterns

definitions.text: make a rupture in the ranks of the enemy or one's own by quitting or fleeing
examples: The ranks broke

definitions.text: curl over and fall apart in surf or foam, of waves
examples: The surf broke

definitions.text: lessen in force or effect
examples: soften a shock
break a fall

definitions.text: be broken in
examples: If the new teacher won't break, we'll add some stress

definitions.text: come to an end
examples: The heat wave finally broke yesterday

definitions.text: vary or interrupt a uniformity or continuity
examples: The flat plain was broken by tall mesas

definitions.text: cause to give up a habit
examples: She finally broke herself of smoking cigarettes

definitions.text: give up
examples: break cigarette smoking

definitions.text: come forth or begin from a state of latency
examples: The first winter storm broke over New York

definitions.text: happen or take place
examples: Things have been breaking pretty well for us in the past few months

definitions.text: cause the failure or ruin of
examples: His peccadilloes finally broke his marriage
This play will either make or break the playwright

definitions.text: invalidate by judicial action
examples: The will was broken

definitions.text: discontinue an association or relation; go different ways
examples: The business partners broke over a tax question
The couple separated after 25 years of marriage
My friend and I split up

definitions.text: assign to a lower position; reduce in rank
examples: She was demoted because she always speaks up
He was broken down to Sergeant

definitions.text: reduce to bankruptcy
examples: My daughter's fancy wedding is going to break me!
The slump in the financial markets smashed him

definitions.text: change directions suddenly
emerge from the surface of a body of water
examples: The whales broke

definitions.text: break down, literally or metaphorically
examples: The wall collapsed
The business collapsed
The dam broke
The roof collapsed
The wall gave in
The roof finally gave under the weight of the ice

definitions.text: do a break dance
examples: Kids were break-dancing at the street corner

definitions.text: exchange for smaller units of money
examples: I had to break a $100 bill just to buy the candy

definitions.text: destroy the completeness of a set of related items
examples: The book dealer would not break the set

definitions.text: make the opening shot that scatters the balls
separate from a clinch, in boxing
examples: The referee broke the boxers

definitions.text: go to pieces
examples: The lawn mower finally broke
The gears wore out
The old chair finally fell apart completely

definitions.text: break a piece from a whole
examples: break a branch from a tree

definitions.text: become punctured or penetrated
examples: The skin broke

definitions.text: pierce or penetrate
examples: The blade broke her skin

definitions.text: be released or become known; of news
examples: News of her death broke in the morning

definitions.text: cease an action temporarily
examples: We pause for station identification
let's break for lunch

definitions.text: interrupt the flow of current in
examples: break a circuit

definitions.text: undergo breaking
examples: The simple vowels broke in many Germanic languages

definitions.text: find a flaw in
examples: break an alibi
break down a proof

definitions.text: find the solution or key to
examples: break the code

definitions.text: change suddenly from one tone quality or register to another
examples: Her voice broke to a whisper when she started to talk about her children

definitions.text: happen
examples: Report the news as it develops
These political movements recrudesce from time to time

definitions.text: become fractured; break or crack on the surface only
examples: The glass cracked when it was heated

definitions.text: crack; of the male voice in puberty
examples: his voice is breaking--he should no longer sing in the choir

definitions.text: fall sharply
examples: stock prices broke

definitions.text: fracture a bone of
examples: I broke my foot while playing hockey

definitions.text: diminish or discontinue abruptly
examples: The patient's fever broke last night

definitions.text: weaken or destroy in spirit or body
examples: His resistance was broken
a man broken by the terrible experience of near-death
